comment: Great professor who has designed an interesting syllabus with diverse educational assignments.  She is extremely well organized, very helpful, and makes the subject very interesting.  Her exams are fair and straight from the text. I would highly recommend her for any Management and Human Behavior in Organizations course, under grad or grad.

Excellent professor! Really knows the subject matter and I work in the HR field so I can tell. She enjoys teaching and is very thorough but very fair as well. Not exaggerating when I say she is simply one of the best instructors I have ever had at any level! Kennesaw State is fortunate to have her.

Class was fair.  Exams are essay and regurgitating difinitions.  She's more research/academic with minimal experince, nothing is related to how its really applicable in the real world.  If you're good at memorizing definitions take her, otherwise the class is boring.

Very good lectures.  Workload is reasonable.  Tries very hard to make everything applicable and encourages stories from class.  But the tests; all essay, tries to be practical, but really you have to memorize the slides, the grading is not subjective if you agree with her, grades consistently but tough.
Good communicator, organized and used good examples.  One of the better professors I've encountered.
Good class. Very subjective grader, but tests are all essays. Tough but fair on presentation grades.

Wonderful personality.  Funny and charismatic.  I learned a great deal from this course ? lots of practical application for the workforce manager. Do not like memorization for the sake of memorizing for her tests; however, that is the nature of this material....
She's pretty cool. I had her for a Web MBA class and she was very competent. Sometimes her grading was a little subjective but I think thats normal for essay questions.
Knew her stuff and pleasant to look at.  Very rare.

Team project guidelines are difficult to understand, but she clarified pretty well. Just follow the instructions verbatim on the assignments and for the tests. Uses way too many bullet points...its kinda luck of the draw if the 100 bullets you can manage to memorize happen to show up on the test essays.

Great teacher-the tests cover a lot of material but if you study the power points you'll do well.  The instructions for the group project were a little unclear and I didn't like having all the other classmates grade the presentations but overall, a great class!
Great teacher, very clear instructions, lots of examples to help you understand the concepts, gives partial credit on essay questions, very approachable and helpful
Very nice person. Great class. Shes new to teaching so does a lot of PPT presentations and quotes the book a lot but with time she will be a great teacher
She is fantastic.  I learned tons, and she was unbelievable clear and makes tons of examples so that everyone can understand what she is talking about.
